title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: It reminded me and Louis of Clova ; only there one did not see the immense extent of mountains behind.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 1 The village of Clova is situated in the northern extremityof Forfarshire, near to the source of the South Esk, in a glenof the Grampians, along which that river flows in a southeastward direction for upwards of ten miles, issuing ot lengthinto a more open course in the romantic vicinity of CortachyCastle, a icat of the Earl of Airly.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But he found only a few Highlanders at Clova,1without the appearance of an army, which he hadpromised himself, and was easily induced to returnto the camp with a party who had been despatchedin pursuit of him.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
